awd_abstract_narration: Covert channels are channels not intended for information                  transfer. A subliminal channel allows one to hide a secret message              inside an authenticator. An abuse enables a participant to us a                 cryptosystem for a different purpose than intended. In this                     project, techniques guaranteeing that such abuses are impossible                are being studied. The main open problems addressed are: (1) can                unconditionally secure authentication schemes be made subliminal-               free, and generally, which systems can be made abuse-free; (2)which             non-trivial systems can be made abuse-free when using only a                    passive warden; (3) can the results be extended to analog and                   digital covert channels?
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
